001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.output;
002
003import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
004import java.io.File;
005import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
006import java.io.FileOutputStream;
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.io.OutputStream;
009import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
010import java.net.URI;
011import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
012import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;
013import java.nio.channels.FileLock;
014import java.util.function.Consumer;
015
016import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
017
018import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
019import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent;
020import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogOutput;
021import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
022import io.jstach.rainbowgum.MetaLog;
023import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
024
025/**
026 * An output that is designed for writing to a file.
027 */
028public interface FileOutput extends LogOutput {
029
030        @Override
031        default OutputType type() {
032                return OutputType.FILE;
033        }
034
035        /**
036         * Creates a file output provider from lambda builder.
037         * @param consumer builder lambda.
038         * @return provider.
039         */
040        public static LogConfig.Provider<FileOutput> of(Consumer<FileOutputBuilder> consumer) {
041                return (s, c) -> {
042                        var builder = new FileOutputBuilder(s);
043                        consumer.accept(builder);
044                        return builder.build();
045                };
046        }
047
048        /**
049         * Creates file output.
050         * @param name name of output not file name.
051         * @param uri file uri.
052         * @param fileName file name.
053         * @param append whether or not to append to existing file.
054         * @param prudent logback prudent mode where files are locked on each write.
055         * @param bufferSize buffer size in bytes.
056         * @return file output.
057         * @throws UncheckedIOException if file not found.
058         */
059        @SuppressWarnings("resource")
060        @LogConfigurable(prefix = LogProperties.OUTPUT_PREFIX)
061        public static FileOutput of(@LogConfigurable.KeyParameter String name, URI uri, String fileName,
062                        @Nullable Boolean append, @Nullable Boolean prudent, @Nullable Integer bufferSize)
063                        throws UncheckedIOException {
064                prudent = prudent == null ? false : prudent;
065                append = append == null ? true : append;
066                File file = new File(fileName);
067                createMissingParentDirectories(file);
068                FileOutputStream stream;
069                try {
070                        stream = new FileOutputStream(file, append);
071                }
072                catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
073                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
074                }
075                if (prudent) {
076                        return new FileChannelOutput(uri, stream.getChannel());
077                }
078                OutputStream s;
079                if (bufferSize == null) {
080                        s = new BufferedOutputStream(stream);
081                }
082                else if (bufferSize > 0) {
083                        s = new BufferedOutputStream(stream, bufferSize);
084                }
085                else {
086                        s = stream;
087                }
088                return new FileOutputStreamOutput(uri, s);
089        }
090
091        /**
092         * Creates the parent directories of a file. If parent directories not specified in
093         * file's path, then nothing is done and this returns gracefully.
094         * @param file file whose parent directories (if any) should be created
095         * @return {@code true} if either no parents were specified, or if all parent
096         * directories were created successfully; {@code false} otherwise
097         */
098        private static boolean createMissingParentDirectories(File file) {
099                File parent = file.getParentFile();
100                if (parent == null) {
101                        // Parent directory not specified, therefore it's a request to
102                        // create nothing. Done! ;)
103                        return true;
104                }
105
106                // File.mkdirs() creates the parent directories only if they don't
107                // already exist; and it's okay if they do.
108                parent.mkdirs();
109                return parent.exists();
110        }
111
112}
113
114class FileOutputStreamOutput extends LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput implements FileOutput {
115
116        protected FileOutputStreamOutput(URI uri, OutputStream outputStream) {
117                super(uri, outputStream);
118        }
119
120}
121
122class FileChannelOutput implements FileOutput {
123
124        protected final URI uri;
125
126        protected final FileChannel channel;
127
128        public FileChannelOutput(URI uri, FileChannel channel) {
129                super();
130                this.uri = uri;
131                this.channel = channel;
132        }
133
134        @Override
135        public URI uri() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
136                return uri;
137        }
138
139        @Override
140        public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType) {
141                write(event, ByteBuffer.wrap(bytes, off, len), contentType);
142        }
143
144        @Override
145        public void write(LogEvent event, ByteBuffer buffer, ContentType contentType) {
146                try {
147
148                        // Clear any current interrupt (see LOGBACK-875)
149                        boolean interrupted = Thread.interrupted();
150
151                        FileLock fileLock = null;
152                        try {
153                                fileLock = channel.lock();
154                                long position = channel.position();
155                                long size = channel.size();
156                                if (size != position) {
157                                        channel.position(size);
158                                }
159                                channel.write(buffer);
160
161                        }
162                        catch (IOException e) {
163                                MetaLog.error(FileChannelOutput.class, e);
164                        }
165                        finally {
166                                if (fileLock != null && fileLock.isValid()) {
167                                        fileLock.release();
168                                }
169                                if (interrupted) {
170                                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
171                                }
172                        }
173                }
174                catch (IOException e) {
175                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
176                }
177        }
178
179        @Override
180        public void close() {
181                try {
182                        channel.close();
183                }
184                catch (IOException e) {
185                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
186                }
187        }
188
189        @Override
190        public void flush() {
191                try {
192                        channel.force(false);
193                }
194                catch (IOException e) {
195                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
196                }
197        }
198
199        @Override
200        public WriteMethod writeMethod() {
201                return WriteMethod.BYTE_BUFFER;
202        }
203
204}
